sub_title: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University
summary: Putika is a corporate lawyer with over five years of experience advising businesses on various legal matters. Prior to her current pursuit, she worked as an associate lawyer at UMBRA - Strategic Legal Solutions, one of the prominent law firms in Jakarta, Indonesia. She has assisted local and major multinational institutions in Indonesia in transactional and advisory matters involving general corporate, mergers & acquisitions, capital market & securities, and technology, media & telecom. She has a proven track record of providing strategic legal advice to clients and managing complex legal matters efficiently. Now, as an Advanced LL.M. candidate at Leiden University, Putika is expanding her legal knowledge in the rapidly evolving field of digital technologies, namely artificial intelligence and data protection.

awards.title: Awardee of CPG Summer School Scholarship 2017
awards.description: CPG designed the program to serve as an academic institute, think tank, and provider of advisory services and facilitators. The summer school program took place for two weeks in July 2017, hosted by the Goethe University in Frankfurt am Main. Throughout the course, participants had the opportunity to enhance their understanding of European and German law through seventeen engaging lectures delivered by renowned German lecturers. The program attracted sixteen individuals from five nations, including Thailand, Malaysia, Singapore, Myanmar, and Indonesia.
awards.issuer: German-Southeast Asian Center of Excellence for Public Policy and Good Governance (CPG)

awards.title: Best Pre-Conference Paper of ALSA International Annual Forum in Hong Kong
awards.description: One of the activities during the ALSA International Annual Forum was the Model United Nations. Participants were divided into four committees to display their diplomatic prowess. These committees represented states and international organizations like Interpol and the IMF. Participants debated a draft resolution for three to four days in an effort to address one of the major global issues: White-Collar Crime. The participants who submitted the best position paper or were the outstanding delegate inside the council received awards for Best Pre-Conference Paper, Best Delegate, and Honorable Mention.

awards.title: Third Place Winner of News Casting Competition in 19th ALSA National English Competition
awards.description: Every year, ALSA LC UI sponsors the National English Competition (ALSA E-COMP) as a way to advance the use of English in everyday conversation. Many high school and university students from all over Indonesia have competed in ALSA E-COMP since it began in 1995. As a result, ALSA E-COMP has successfully demonstrated its existence for 18 years and has eight branches of competitions, including debate, speech, news casting, spelling bee, battle of the brains, storytelling, paper presentation, and E-COMP Model United Nation (E-MUN).

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted Ministry of State-owned Enterprises, PT Len Industri (Persero), PT Dirgantara Indonesia, PT Dahana, PT PAL Indonesia, and PT Pindad for the establishment of Indonesian State-Owned Defence Industry Holding
projects.description:
UMBRA is beyond proud to announce the establishment of the Indonesian Defense Industry (Defend ID) State-Owned Enterprises Holding Group.

UMBRA Senior Partner, Ahmad Zakaria, alongside with Senior Associate, Paula Aprijanto, and Associate Putika Nuralida Herdin assisted the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs), PT Len Industri (Persero), PT Dirgantara Indonesia, PT PAL Indonesia, PT Dahana, and PT Pindad, in establishing this holding group, which aimed to create Alpalhankam (defense and security equipment) independence and integrate the SOEs of C5ISR (Command, Control, Communication, Computer, Cyber, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance) industry to maximize business efficiency.

The establishment of this holding group marks yet another successful deal that UMBRA proudly presents in helping the establishment of SOEs Holding Groups, following the establishment of Indonesian Food-Estate SOEs Holding Group, Indonesian Pharmacy SOEs Holding Group, and Indonesian Oil and Gas SOEs Holding Group.

With that being said, UMBRA is thrilled to remark that UMBRA is the only law firm with the highest closing of the establishment of SOEs Holding Group. Indeed, these experiences cement the commitment as the leading firm in providing premier legal services for SOEs, for UMBRA perceives the intricate nature of SOE’s business as not only challenging but predominantly exciting.

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted Ministry of State-owned Enterprises, PT Rajawali Nusantara Indonesia (Persero), PT Perindo, PT SHS, PT PPI, PT Berdikari, and PT Garam for the establishment of Indonesian State-Owned Food Holding
projects.description:
UMBRA has succesfully assisted the establishment of the Indonesian Food State-Owned Enterprise Holding Group where UMBRA Senior Partners Ahmad Zakaria, and Liyanto Wijaya, Senior Associate Paula Aprijanto, and Associates Putika Nuralida Herdin, Christofer Ruminsar, and Leanna Leonardo assisted the Ministry of SOEs, PT Rajawali Nusantara Indonesia (Persero), PT Perikanan Indonesia, PT Sang Hyang Seri, PT Perusahaan Perdagangan Indonesia, PT Garam, and PT Berdikari in one of the most complex establishments of state-owned enterprise holding groups to date.

This state-of-the-art transaction involves a combination of mergers of six companies with different legal status, requiring a complex process of converting some of the entities into limited liability companies before the merger can occur. We advise on the entire aspects of the transaction including structuring of the transaction, compliance review, transaction documents, and large-scale employment matters, resulting in the establishment of a single entity of Food SOE Holding.

The creation of the Food SOE Holding is expected to improve the business performance and integration along the food value chain for the purpose of leading the entire national food ecosystem and is a part of Government’s strategic plan of ensuring food sufficiency for the nation, being a crucial element for making a successful development of Indonesia. The Food SOE Holding will also further collaborate with other SOEs, business clusters, and private sectors and, ultimately, become a world-class food company.

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk in its offering of Commercial Paper with a maximum value of Rp500 billion
projects.description:
Led by Senior Partner Ahmad Zakaria, UMBRA acted as the legal counsel to PT Jasa Marga (Persero) Tbk as the issuer in their first public offering of commercial papers.

The transaction marks the biggest offering of commercial papers in Indonesia’s money market, so far. The commercial papers have been rated idA1+ (A1+) by PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia (PEFINDO).

UMBRA is honored to have this opportunity to assist Jasa Marga, as one of the Indonesian leading infrastructure providers, in such a successful offering. Having already been provided various sources of financing through the capital market, the issuance of commercial papers will enable Jasa Marga to further diversify its funding sources. Hopefully, many more Indonesian corporations will be interested to follow the path of Jasa Marga and explore alternative financing schemes, particularly money market instruments.

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises and PT Bio Farma (Persero), Tbk in the Establishment of Indonesian Pharmaceutical Holding Company
projects.description:
UMBRA has successfully assisted in the establishment of the Indonesian Pharmacy State-Owned Enterprises Holding Group. In this Rp12.4 trillion corporate restructuring transaction, our senior partner Ahmad Zakaria and his associates assisted the Ministry of SOEs, PT Kimia Farma Tbk., PT Indofarma Tbk., and PT Bio Farma (Persero) in their grand plan of creating a world-class pharmaceutical group company. The long-awaited holding structure is intended to improve the efficiency of the Indonesian pharmaceutical business, as well as reduce the importation of active pharmaceutical ingredients. This initiative is also expected to increase coordination among and technical specialization of each group member, ensuring that the group could provide integrated services and support the Government’s healthcare program.

With the completion of this deal, UMBRA stands as the only law firm in Indonesia that has successfully closed multiple establishments of SOEs holding groups, cementing its position as the leading firm in dealing with the complex nature of SOEs’ business and management.

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted PT Pertamina (Persero) in its offering of USD10 billion Global Medium-Term Notes program
projects.description: Led by UMBRA Partners, Pramudya A. Oktavinanda and Ahmad Zakaria, and Associate, Paula Aprijanto, UMBRA recently acted as the issuer counsel for PT Pertamina (Persero) in its successful issuance of USD1.5 billion global bonds which will be used to support the company’s capital expenditure budget. Hailed as one of the largest global bonds issuances by an Indonesian Company in 2019 (if not the largest so far), it is a landmark deal for Pertamina as it secured the best interest rates among all of its global bonds offerings throughout the years, demonstrating a very positive market perception on the financial and business strength of Pertamina.

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) for the establishment of State-Owned Holding Company for Oil & Gas

contributors.headline: Adv. LL.M. Candidate in Law and Digital Technologies at Leiden University

projects.title: Assisted PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk in its US$2.8 billion acquisition of PT Pertamina Gas (a subsidiary of PT Pertamina (Persero))
projects.description:
On 28 December 2018, PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) completed the US$1.35 billion (equivalent to Rp20 trillion) acquisition of 51% shares of PT Pertamina Gas (Pertagas) from PT Pertamina (Persero), signifying the completion of Indonesian Oil & Gas Holding Company formation. Fajar Sampurno, Deputy of Mining Business Sector of the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises, conveyed that this deal represents Indonesia’s largest state capital participation in 2018.

Acting as PGN’s legal counsel in this exciting deal (led by UMBRA senior partners, Reggy Firmansyah and Ahmad Zakaria), UMBRA is extremely proud to be a part of Indonesia’s government strategic plan of establishing multiple state-owned holding companies that are intended to boost business synergies and efficiencies among Indonesian state-owned enterprises and ultimately, contribute to the betterment of Indonesian people.

On top of all, this crucial integration is expected to increase the role of the Indonesian Oil & Gas Holding Company in strengthening Indonesian oil & gas infrastructure as well as saving investment costs with no duplication of infrastructure development between PGN and Pertagas.

company.name: Student Community Services Program of UGM

volunteer_experiences.description: JOINMUN is an immersive Model United Nations simulation organized by the Community of MUN at Universitas Gadjah Mada. This highly acclaimed event took place from November 11th to November 14th at Harper Mangkubumi in Yogyakarta. JOINMUN stands as one of the most prestigious MUNs ever organized in Indonesia, attracting distinguished speakers, skilled chairs, and participants from around the globe, including Malaysia, Thailand, and Japan. With the theme "Recalling the Past, Remapping the Future," JOINMUN aimed to explore the uncertainties of power distribution in global affairs.
